Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a flat bowl-like body, a flat circular base, a short splayed nozzle and a vertical ring-handle. There is a central filling-hole, and six subsidiary holes spaced round the discus edge. Decorated with palmettes, bead-and-reel, and double cable-moulding.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q571)
